Machine Learning ISPeL Fall 2020 GitHub

Machine Learning

Relevant topics and the dependencies between topics have been identified. The prerequisites for topics have been integrated into the layout of the material so that learners can personalize their path of study within each topic.

As a guide to the learner, each module below begins with an Introduction that describes the preliminaries for the topic and this is where we suggest that every learner should begin. The materials presented are based on the ontology constructed by Dr. Rui Wu, Grayson Blankenship and other research members of the ISPeL System Project Team funded by the NSF as part of the PPSE

A learner can proceed as they are inclined within the module to create their own path among the topics. The concepts within the modules are intended to be discovered in any order.

Machine Learning available topics:

  1. Introduction
  2. K_Means
  3. KNN
  4. Statistical Learning
  5. Linear Regression
  6. Evaluation
  7. Hyperplane

Introduction

Intro needed.

  2. Supervised Learning

  3. Unsupervised Learning

intro needed.

  1. Introduction

  2. Properties of Functions

KNN

intro needed.

  1. Introduction

  2. Properties of Sets

  3. Operations on Sets

  4. Partitions and Relations

  5. Modular Arithmetic

Statistical Learning

  1. Introduction

  2. Combinations

  3. Permutations

Linear Regression

  2. Random Variables

  3. Outcome Space

Evaluation

  1. Introduction

  2. Axioms of a Group

  3. Examples of Groups
